content: it's September 1, which means...one month until Roctoberfest 2023! :smiley:

for those who are new here since last year, Roctoberfest is where we get a group of people together to go through last year's Advent of Code in Roc, during the month of October. This lets us find out how the new user experience is right now, what papercuts or bugs or missing pieces there are for a nice Advent of Code experience, etc...while still having the month of November to make improvements before the actual Advent of Code!
this was really helpful last year, and it surfaced a lot of things that otherwise we wouldn't have known to prioritize for last year's Advent of Code
so if anyone knows people who might be interested in participating this year, it's never too soon to start asking around!
I'm interested. I've done Advent of Code a number of times but skipped 2023, and I've tried out roc just a little bit but definitely still count as a new user.
if you know anyone else who might be interested, now's a good time to ask!

Hey @Richard Feldman :)
I would also be interested. I'm new to roc, got very interested after seeing some of your talks on YT. I have a little experience in elm which made me curious about roc in the first place. I would love to help in moving it forward!
that's awesome, welcome @capthiron! :grinning:
would it be fine for someone to start roctoberfest early or is there anything close to being merged that would be worth the wait? :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:
haha I think now is fine if you like, although maybe fun to wait and start with a group? Up to you though!
